page.title: 06CUSTOMS IN BRYNNA
page.content: There are lots of customs in Brynna but the most important is St. Davids day in the school the children learnt welsh songs and welsh poems and always wore a Daffodil or a leek .After the celebration all the children of the school had half day.Now the tradition is still going strong and now the girls wear welsh costumes. There are lots of different events in Brynnau one of them was going to the Band of Hope meeting every Monday in the vestry that use to be at the side of the school. On Easter Monday all the chidren from Llanharan and Brynnau school use to met at Dolau and walked back to bethlehem church to attend a service and after wards they all had tea in the vestry.{By Emma M.+ RACHEL R. A typical weekday of a 11year old
